title: Eamonn Holmes awkwardly caught on his phone during Shalamar performance
text:

Eamonn Holmes was awkwardly caught on his phone during Shalamar's performance on today's This Morning.

The 80s chart-toppers, who are on the UK leg of their world tour, sang classic hit 'A Night To Remember' in the studio.

Howard Hewett, Jeffrey Daniel and Carolyn Griffey turned back time with their performance, which received mixed reviews from viewers.

One person who didn't seem very interested was Eamonn, who didn't realise the camera was on him as the band belted out their tune.

Ruth Langsford was singing and dancing away, but her husband was tapping away on his mobile device.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

This Morning viewers took to Twitter after spotting Eamonn on his phone.

One viewer tweeted: "Eammon on his phone. What a mood"

"When you are bored at a concert...," added another.

A third said: "Eamon having a cheeky look on twitter"

"I love him. No f***s given," said a fourth.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

The band are glad to be in the UK as part of their world tour.

Jeffrey said: "It's got to be one of the best audiences we have on the planet. So enthusiastic. Everyone up there dancing and having a party. Singing along."

Howard explained their fans from the 80s were now bringing their kids along.

Revealing what would be on their set list, Carolyn said: "We have a single we realised last year and we do it but the fans come to hear the classic hits."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

There were mixed review of Shamalar's performance of 'A Night To Remember'.

One fan said: "Omg Shalamar on #thismorning still sound Amazing!"

"Oh I loved that!! Got me right in the Friday mood," added another.

However, one viewer joked: "Think that might be a night to forget!"

"Pick a note, any note Shalamar," said a fellow joker.

*This Morning airs weekdays on ITV at 10.30am
description: The This Morning host didn't realise the camera was on him while he tapped away as the 80s band sang 'A Night To Remember'
